heroIntro:
Imagine waking to Mediterranean sunshine, stepping onto your private terrace, and planning a leisurely day by one of Costa Blanca's pristine Blue Flag beaches. This stunning 2-bedroom penthouse in La Marina offers exactly that lifestyle—a sophisticated holiday home that doubles as a savvy investment. Priced at €290,000, this property delivers premium specification at 40% less than comparable Spanish island markets, making it an exceptional value proposition for discerning buyers seeking a sunshine retreat without the island price tag.

La Marina is where European holidaymakers have discovered the perfect balance between authentic Spanish coastal living and modern amenities. This penthouse represents contemporary comfort in one of the Costa Blanca's most sought-after development areas. With 78 square meters of thoughtfully designed living space, every detail has been considered for maximum comfort and relaxation during your Mediterranean getaways.

Whether you're planning extended holidays, seeking a second home for winter escapes, or looking for a property with strong rental income potential, this La Marina penthouse ticks every box. The €290,000 price point positions this as one of the best-value premium properties currently available on the Costa Blanca, with the area trending upward at 8% year-on-year growth.
areaSection: La Marina sits on the southern Costa Blanca, approximately 40 minutes south of Alicante city and just 20 minutes from the regional airport. This coastal district has transformed into a vibrant residential community while maintaining its authentic Spanish charm. The area benefits from a microclimate that delivers consistent sunshine year-round—over 300 days annually—making it ideal for holiday home owners who want guaranteed good weather during their escapes. The Mediterranean Sea provides the dramatic backdrop, with multiple Blue Flag beaches within 20 minutes offering crystal-clear waters perfect for swimming, paddleboarding, and water sports. The terrain is pleasantly flat, with modern developments seamlessly integrated into the landscape, and local infrastructure continues to expand to meet the needs of its growing international community.
lifestyleSection: Life in La Marina revolves around outdoor living, coastal relaxation, and accessible luxury. The established expat community means English is widely spoken, making day-to-day life comfortable for international residents. Your mornings might start with coffee at a beachfront café, followed by a leisurely stroll through the weekly markets where local vendors sell fresh produce, local cheeses, and Mediterranean delicacies. Afternoon activities range from championship golf courses minutes away to beach clubs offering everything from tapas to sunset cocktails. The local supermarkets—Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum—stock international products alongside Spanish favorites, catering to diverse tastes. Evenings see locals and visitors alike gathering at family-run restaurants specializing in fresh seafood and regional cuisine. The pace is unhurried, the weather is reliably sunny, and the cost of living remains remarkably reasonable compared to Northern Europe, allowing your holiday budget to stretch further.
investmentSection: Beyond the lifestyle benefits, this penthouse represents solid financial logic. The Costa Blanca property market has grown 8% year-on-year, with La Marina outperforming broader averages as investors recognize the area's combination of livability and appreciation potential. At €3,718 per square meter, this property trades at a significant premium to the area average of €2,200/m², reflecting its quality specification—yet costs 40% less than comparable properties in Spanish island markets like Ibiza or Mallorca. Rental potential is compelling: similar properties in La Marina typically command €800 per week during peak season (July-August), rising to €1,200 for premium bookings. A conservative estimate suggests annual rental income of €25,000-€30,000 if let for 10-12 weeks yearly, easily offsetting holding costs and contributing toward eventual appreciation.
conclusion: This penthouse represents more than a property transaction—it's an investment in a Mediterranean lifestyle that delivers genuine returns. At €290,000 with premium specification 40% cheaper than Spanish islands, positioned in a market growing 8% annually, with proven holiday rental income potential, this La Marina home checks every box for sophisticated holiday home buyers. Whether you envision long Mediterranean summers with family and friends, or steady income from short-term lettings during months you're elsewhere, this property works harder than most. The established expat community, reliable sunshine, accessible beaches, and remarkable value proposition make La Marina an increasingly popular choice for international buyers seeking alternatives to saturated island markets. lifeAndAmenities.intro: La Marina offers all the conveniences of modern living with the relaxed pace of a Mediterranean coastal town. Daily necessities are accessible, entertainment options are abundant, and the established international community means services cater to both Spanish residents and international visitors.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in the La Marina area combines accessibility with quality. The regional hospital system is comprehensive, with Hospital Universitario San Juan de Alicante approximately 30 minutes away providing all major specialties and emergency services. For routine care, several private clinics operate throughout the area with English-speaking doctors experienced in treating international residents. Prescription medications are readily available and significantly less expensive than in Northern Europe. Many property owners maintain health insurance through private providers offering comprehensive coverage and direct access to specialists. The area has a long-established reputation for retirees and older expat residents, meaning healthcare infrastructure is well-developed and culturally attuned to international needs.

education.text: La Marina and surrounding areas host several established international schools following British and other European curricula. These schools serve the substantial expat population and are well-regarded for academic standards and pastoral care. International options include schools in nearby Altea and Benidorm, typically 20-30 minutes away. Spanish state schools provide high-quality education at no cost, and many international students successfully integrate into Spanish schools with language support. The area's established international community means educational support services, tutoring, and after-school activities are readily available and professionally managed.

shopping.text: Shopping in La Marina combines convenience with authentic Spanish experience. Major supermarket chains including Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum provide competitive pricing and wide product selection including international items for expat needs. Weekly markets in nearby towns offer fresh produce, local cheeses, Mediterranean olives, and seafood at prices remarkably lower than Northern Europe. Larger shopping centers in Benidorm (20 minutes) provide department stores, fashion retailers, and entertainment facilities. The combination ensures shopping here is both practical and pleasurable—quality food at excellent prices with the authentic atmosphere of traditional markets.

transport.text: Getting around La Marina is straightforward, with flexibility being key. Alicante-Elche Airport, Spain's third-largest, is approximately 35 kilometers away (40 minutes by car) with direct flights to most European capitals and excellent connectivity for holiday home owners. Local bus services connect La Marina to neighboring towns and beaches, making a car optional for those preferring not to drive. However, car rental is inexpensive (€25-€40 daily) and highly recommended for maximum flexibility exploring the Costa Blanca. Driving is straightforward with well-maintained roads and reasonable fuel costs. For longer journeys, trains connect Alicante to Madrid and other Spanish cities.

faqs.question: Wie viel kostet diese Immobilie?
faqs.answer: €290,000 for this 2-bedroom penthouse. The price includes premium specification finishes at 40% less than comparable Spanish island properties. Flexible payment terms and financing options are available for qualifying international buyers.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-EU foreigners can purchase property in Spain with no restrictions. EU citizens have identical rights to Spanish nationals. The process involves obtaining a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), and most transactions close within 4-6 weeks. English-speaking lawyers and property agents guide international buyers through every step.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €290,000 purchase price, expect approximately 8-10% additional costs: 6% property transfer tax, 1-1.5% for notary and registry fees, and approximately 1% for legal representation. Annual costs include property tax (around 0.4% of cadastral value), community fees if applicable, and optional insurance. These costs are lower than many Northern European countries.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers excellent value, proven rental income potential, and strong year-on-year appreciation (8% currently). The combination of year-round sunshine, established expat communities, affordable living costs, and international airport access makes it one of Spain's most investor-friendly regions. La Marina specifically has outperformed broader regional averages.

faqs.question: Welches Mieteinnahmenpotenzial hat diese Immobilie?
faqs.answer: Similar 2-bedroom properties in La Marina typically command €800-€1,000 weekly during peak season (July-August), with shoulder season rates around €600-€700. Conservative estimates suggest €25,000-€30,000 annual income if let for 10-12 weeks yearly. Professional property management companies handle bookings, cleaning, and guest relations for approximately 25-30% of revenue.

faqs.question: Wie weit ist die Costa Blanca von Deutschland entfernt?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport is 2 hours flight time from most UK airports (London, Manchester, Birmingham). Direct flights operate daily from major UK cities, with budget airlines keeping costs reasonable. Flight time means quick weekend escapes from the UK are practical, making La Marina ideal for holiday home ownership from Britain.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually with average temperatures of 18°C in winter and 28°C in summer. Rain is minimal, typically occurring in autumn. This consistent, predictable weather makes it ideal for holiday home ownership—you'll have excellent conditions during planned visits and peak rental season.

faqs.question: Brauche ich ein Visum, um Immobilien in Spanien zu kaufen?
faqs.answer: EU citizens do not require any special visa to purchase property or establish residency. Non-EU citizens can purchase property without a residence visa, though a tourist visa may be needed for initial entry. The property purchase does not grant residency, though Spain offers residency visas for retirees (with pension income) and wealthy investors (€500,000+ property investment).

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreigners, typically up to 70-80% loan-to-value ratio. Interest rates are competitive (currently around 3-4% for fixed-rate mortgages). Most require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and proof of income. International buyers often find Spanish mortgages more attractive than refinancing in home countries.

faqs.question: Why is this property cheaper than Spanish islands?
faqs.answer: Island properties (Ibiza, Mallorca, Menorca) command premium pricing due to limited supply and international celebrity association. Costa Blanca mainland locations offer identical weather, superior transportation access, and lower costs—meaning you get premium specification at fraction of island prices. This penthouse at €3,718/m² would cost €6,200+/m² on Ibiza.
